item.title: Kate add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I cannot fix on the hour, or the spot, or the look or the words, which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kate add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "Love is holy because it is like grace--the worthiness of its object is never really what matters." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Kate add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Being in a relationship, that's something you choose. Being friends, that's just something you are. [But] I <i>do</i> pick you. We've been friends too long to pick, but if we could pick, I'd pick you." -- John Green

item.title: Kate add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, not the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kate add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "We should meet in another life, we should meet in air, me and you." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kate add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Kate add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Things are always better in the morning." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Kate add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "You have to pick the places you don't walk away from." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Kate add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Time is the school in which we learn." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Kate add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "Having a sister or a friend is like sitting at night in a lighted house. Those outside can watch you if they want, but you need not see them. You simply say, "Here are the perimeters of our attention. If you prowl around under the windows till the crickets go silent, we will pull the shades. If you wish us to suffer your envious curiosity, you must permit us not to notice it." Anyone with one solid human bond is that smug, and it is the smugness as much as the comfort and safety that lonely people covet and admire." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Kate add a quote by Natalie Babbitt
item.description: "Like all magnificent things, it's very simple." -- Natalie Babbitt
